alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence; Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Woodruff, southern Independence, northern Prairie, Jackson, eastern White and southeastern Lawrence Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 129 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pleasant Plains to Judsonia to near Hickory Plains. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Searcy... Newport... Augusta... Des Arc... Bald Knob... Judsonia... Tuckerman... Kensett... Diaz... Newark... Swifton... Higginson... Patterson... Grubbs... Pleasant Plains... Oil Trough... Russell... Jacksonport... Magness... West Point... This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 43 and 101, and between mile markers 109 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for eastern, central and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Independence; Jackson; Lawrence; Prairie; White; Woodruff
